Detailed Description

Class FileBinData implements the BinData interface for files of the APOXI Root File System (RFS).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FileBinData::FileBinData (   )  [protected]
 

FileBinData::~FileBinData (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BinData * FileBinData::Clone (   )  const [virtual]
 

Clones the BinData object. Cloning is useful if a BinData object is already obtained by one object, but another object wants to access the same data too. The cloned BinData object must be released by BinData::ReleaseInstance if it is not needed anymore. 0 is returned if the cloning has failed.

Reimplemented from BinData.

FileBinData * FileBinData::CreateInstance (  const FilePtr &  file  )  [static]
 

Creates and returns a ready to use object of this class. The binary data is read from file. If file is not yet open it will be opened in read only mode. On destruction of the object the file will be closed. If file does not exist or specifies a directory 0 is returned. Another reason for failure and returning 0 is an out of memory condition.

Parameters:
file The source file.
Returns:
A ready to use object or 0 on failure.

FileBinData * FileBinData::CreateInstance (  const Path &  file_path  )  [static]
 

Creates and returns a ready to use object of this class. The binary data is read from file at file_path. If the file is not yet open it will be opened in read only mode. On destruction of the object the file will be closed. If the file does not exist or specifies a directory 0 is returned. Another reason for failure and returning 0 is an out of memory condition.

Parameters:
file_path The path of the source file.
Returns:
A ready to use object or 0 on failure.

UINT32 FileBinData::GetLength (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the number of bytes which are hold by this object.

Implements BinData.

MemMap * FileBinData::ObtainMemMap (  UINT32  idx,
UINT32  size
)  const [virtual]
 

Obtains a memory map from the given index idx with the specified size size. A size of -1 returns a MemMap to the end of data. 0 is returned if obtaining a memory map is not supported on the bin data object.

Reimplemented from BinData.

UINT32 FileBinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
void *  buf,
UINT32  nbytes
)  const [virtual]
 

Reads byte_count bytes starting from the offset idx into buffer buf. Returns the number of read bytes.

Implements BinData.

BOOLEAN FileBinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
UINT8 &  val
)  const [virtual]
 

Returns a single byte in val at the given index idx. val is not changed if idx does not exist.

Returns:
TRUE if a value at the index exists, FALSE otherwise.

Implements BinData.

void FileBinData::ReleaseMemMap (  MemMap **  h_map  )  const [virtual]
 

Releases a MemMap which has been obtained by BinData::ObtainMemMap.

Reimplemented from BinData.
